H0.text: Summer is the season in the United States when the South Pole is tilted toward the Sun.

H1.text: Fall is the season in the United States when the South Pole is tilted toward the Sun.

H2.text: Winter is the season in the United States when the South Pole is tilted toward the Sun.

H3.text: Spring is the season in the United States when the South Pole is tilted toward the Sun.

A4.text: When it is summer in the Northern Hemisphere, it is winter in the Southern Hemisphere, and vice versa.
